componentDescription:
## ARIA

If the progress bar is describing the loading progress of a particular region of a page,
you should use `aria-describedby` to point to the progress bar, and set the `aria-busy`
attribute to `true` on that region until it has finished loading.

propDescriptions.classes: Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See CSS API below for more details.
propDescriptions.color: The color of the component. It supports both default and custom theme colors, which can be added as shown in the palette customization guide.
propDescriptions.disableShrink: If true, the shrink animation is disabled. This only works if variant is indeterminate.
propDescriptions.size: The size of the circle. If using a number, the pixel unit is assumed. If using a string, you need to provide the CSS unit, e.g '3rem'.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
propDescriptions.value: The value of the progress indicator for the determinate variant. Value between 0 and 100.
propDescriptions.variant: The variant to use. Use indeterminate when there is no progress value.

root.description: Styles applied to the root element.
